summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger regarding the process for proposing and docketing redactions to filings related to expert testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It outlines the procedural steps for filing redacted documents with the court.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding redaction procedures for filings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding redaction procedures for filings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

connections.description: Both are defense counsel addressed together in procedural correspondence regarding the Maxwell case filings.

events.title: Email on Redaction Procedures
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails defense counsel outlining the process for proposing and docketing redactions to filings related to expert testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document is procedural correspondence regarding redactions in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
It outlines a specific process for filing redacted versions of motions and replies with the court.
The communication is between a federal prosecutor and defense counsel, indicating ongoing pre-trial litigation.
